alert.note: Alert for Pemiscot (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 12 at 1:01PM CST until March 20 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi...Arkansas...Tennessee...Missouri... Mississippi River at Tunica Mhoon Landing Mississippi River Above Tiptonville Mississippi River at Osceola Mississippi River at Caruthersville For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY, MARCH 20... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Caruthersville. * WHEN...Until Sunday, March 20. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, In Tennessee, Barr Road along the Middle Fork of the Forked Deer River is flooding near the bridge at the south end of Watkins Road. Water from the north bottom of Lauderdale County is now flowing over the basin boundary into the south bottomm of Lauderdale County. In Missouri, large business just north of Caruthersville is beginning to flood. Many fields adjacent to the Interstate 155 bridge are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CST Saturday the stage was 34.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 34.3 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
